answers.answer: Hello,For numbness and cold sensations, get parasthesia ruled out. It is due to dysfunctioning of neurons. It can be due to diabetes, hypothyroidism, peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition. Get her blood flow to extremities checked from a physician.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: i'm not sure where else to put this question, so since i am female, i figured this would be a good start. i suppose i am more or less looking for reassurance on this whole situation.the other day, i felt like my left leg was numb, but it wasn't. it feels like my leg is FREEZING cold. but when i touch it, it feels the same as my right leg. when i put a cold compress on my leg, it sort of burns, which tells me it may be a nerve issue?because i don't care much for dr. google, i figured i would ask here and see if anyone else has been through this. and if so, what happened?thank you SO much in advance.
title: COLD LEGS, but not to the touch?
